info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 4:01PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Habersham, Rabun and northwestern Oconee Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 401 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southeast of Clayton, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clayton, Mountain City, Tiger, Dillard, Sky Valley, Tallulah Falls, Lake Rabun, Lake Burton, Lakemont and Tallulah Gorge State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
